title: Ramasamy: UM's panel on alleged racism an 'exercise in futility'
text:
More 
Penang Deputy Chief Minister II P Ramasamy said a five-member panel formed by Universiti Malaya (UM) to probe alleged racism against one of its lecturers might prove to be an "exercise in futility”. 
The senior DAP leader said similar reports earlier of racism in public institutions against lecturers and staffs had gone unpunished. 
“Given this, the public might not have the confidence on the panel in investigating and punishing the lecturer if found to be guilty,” Ramasamy said in a statement. 
His remark was in reference to the latest move by Deputy Education Minister P Kamalanathan, who had referred the allegations to UM vice-chancellor Prof Dr Amin Jalaludin. 
According to the deputy minister, Amir had promised to investigate the matter by the appointment of this special committee. 
But Ramasamy took Kamalanathan to task for his reportedly “very poor and miserable record” in taking up issues affecting Indian students.
